alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Holmes; Knox; Richland; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 10:07PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northeast Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Ashland, Knox and Richland. In northeast Ohio, Holmes and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, culverts, and ditches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1005 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to repetitive showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Vernon, Loudonville, Fredericktown, Gambier, Bellville, Centerburg, Danville, Glenmont, Nashville, Waterford, Butler, Perrysville, Lucas, Martinsburg, Gann, North Liberty, Bladensburg and Mohicanville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
